intro: Psychotria dispersa, commonly known as the white psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Psychotria dispersa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats.
